channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Italy’s plan to detain migrants in Albania hits first legal obstacle
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faiola, Zoeann Murphy, Stefano Pitrelli
item.description: Italy’s far-right government wants to offshore the processing of asylum claims. But the first migrants sent to Albania were deemed ineligible for detention there.

item.title: Israelis, Palestinians brace for aftermath of Sinwar’s killing in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Claire Parker
item.description: There is a diplomatic push to restart cease-fire talks, but Israeli hard-liners want to shatter Hamas and Hezbollah and deliver a blow to Iran.

item.title: South Korea says at least 1,500 North Korean special forces troops are in Russia
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Michelle Lee, Ellen Francis
item.description: South Korea’s spy agency said the direct military cooperation between Russia and North Korea has been confirmed with its new evidence.

item.title: Live Briefing: Sinwar’s death offers ‘significant window of opportunity,’ Israeli president says
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Adela Suliman, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: President Joe Biden said he has urged Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to “also make this moment an opportunity to seek a path to peace, a better future in Gaza without loss.”

item.title: Here are other key developments today
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Adela Suliman, Bryan Pietsch

item.title: London’s National Gallery bans liquids after activist art attacks
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho
item.description: Activists have attacked artwork at the National Gallery in London five times, the gallery said. Just Stop Oil said the threat from climate change was much more serious.

item.title: The growing conflict between Canada and India, explained
item.dc:creator: Amanda Coletta
item.description: India made a “horrific mistake” when it thought it could target opponents on Canadian soil, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said.

item.title: Israelis and Palestinians brace for aftermath of Sinwar’s killing in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Claire Parker

item.title: Israel bars six medical NGOs from entry to Gaza, WHO says
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Cate Brown
item.description: The World Health Organization said Israel provided no explanation for barring its partner organizations from the Strip, where the health-care system has collapsed.

item.title: Biden meets with world leaders amid uncertainty in Middle East and Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Cleve R. Wootson Jr., Kate Brady, Matt Viser
item.description: The U.S. leader also spoke of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, the architect of the deadly Oct. 7, 2023, attack on Israel whose death was confirmed Thursday by the Israeli military.

item.title: Israel bars six medical NGOs from entry to Gaza, WHO says
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Cate Brown

item.title: The U.S.-Mexico border, the wall and the thousands of acres between them
item.dc:creator: Nick Miroff, Kirsten Luce, Laris Karklis, Frank Hulley-Jones
item.description: Documents show the completion of the wall in the lower Rio Grande Valley would leave an area five times the size of Manhattan on the wrong side of the divide.

item.title: International telecom deal a sign of hope for Ukraine’s battered economy
item.dc:creator: David Stern
item.description: The EBRD and IFC are providing a long-term loan of $400 million to investors for a telecom merger in the first major foreign investment since the Russian invasion.

item.title: ‘Sinwar’s death ends a reign of terror’: World leaders react to the killing of Hamas leader
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall, Andrew Jeong

item.title: Former Olympic snowboarder accused of operating deadly drug enterprise
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables
item.description: Authorities allege Ryan Wedding, who is believed to live in Mexico, and his organization moved about 60 tons of cocaine a year and orchestrated multiple murders.

item.title: Trump’s love for tariffs is the bluntest expression of a wider trend

item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, Loveday Morris, Michael Birnbaum
item.description: The Biden administration has long hoped that the killing of Hamas’s military chief in Gaza could be the victory Benjamin Netanyahu needs to finally end the war.

item.title: U.S. charges former Indian spy linked to murder plot in New York
item.dc:creator: Ellen Nakashima, Greg Miller
item.description: The Justice Department charged Vikash Yadav, a former Indian intelligence officer, in a foiled assassination plot on U.S. soil, after Biden administration officials grew frustrated with India’s own investigation into wrongdoing.

item.description: A small flotilla, a big mission and a daunting obstacle. Today, we voyage into the most contested waterway in the world: the South China Sea.
